posts.text: Personally, from a "data story telling" perspective, I think in this case the number 19 is more dramatic and cognizable than that percentage, but this sort of thing is more of a stylistic choice. less about math than communication and how humans perceive magnitude.

reply_context.text: They do both. It's printed on the graph that the data corresponds to the top N=19 individuals, and the percentage is an alternative way of communicating how concentrated this is by implicitly dividing N by the total population.

posts.text: Just 19 people control more than 2% of America's wealth.

for one thing: it empowers you to make better decisions even when it might not have occurred to you to involve an LLM. For example, most people don't know that a single queue with N servers is faster than N single-server queues. My knowledge of complexity helps me find the shortest checkout line.

A lot of people, including me, were wondering how an IRB could ever approve this study. 

The answer is that no IRB did. The person who ‚Äúsigned off‚Äù on approval from the only ethics board that reviewed it had resigned three years earlier. His signature was used without his knowledge.
As it was before, so it is now and will be forevermore: the real art underlying CS is learning how to manage complexity.
